intro: Euphrasia bottnica, commonly known as the northern eyebright, is a flowering plant native to northern regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces numerous tiny flowers that bloom in early summer. Euphrasia bottnica is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
